COP30: Has the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energies truly begun?
subhead: Since the 2015 Paris Agreement on climate change, solar and wind power have grown at a phenomenal pace, yet coal, oil and gas remain dominant. The United Nations COP30 climate summit in Belem, Brazil, will test the political will of states to organize a phase-out of fossil fuels.

Trump hails Syria's president a 'strong leader' after historic closed-door talks at the White House
US government shutdown: Democrats split in the Senate, paving the way to end budget deadlock
subhead: After 40 days of shutdown, eight Democratic senators gave in on Sunday, joining their voices with the Republicans in support of a bill aimed at ending the federal government's paralysis. The decision drew criticism within their own ranks due to the limited concessions obtained.

title: US mediator Kushner and Netanyahu discuss phase two of Gaza truce
subhead: Jared Kushner, the son-in-law of US President Donald Trump who helped broker the ceasefire, met Netanyahu in Jerusalem on Monday as part of US efforts to stabilize the truce and lay the groundwork for its next phase.

title: The tiger and the magpie, from Korean mythology to Netflix screens
subhead: The success of the American animated film 'KPop Demon Hunters' has renewed South Koreans' interest in 'hojakdo,' a traditional genre that depicts tigers and magpies. Exhibitions, cultural events and culinary creations are celebrating the popularity of Derpy the tiger and Suzy the magpie, characters from the film.

title: On the Syrian Golan Heights, Israel uses the same tools of repression as in the West Bank
subhead: Israel took advantage of the fall of the Assad regime to expand the area of southern Syria it has occupied since 1967. With uprootings of olive trees, arbitrary arrests and mobile checkpoints, soldiers have imposed a similar regime to that enforced on the population of the Palestinian territory.

She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.

title: What is left of Yitzhak Rabin's legacy, 30 years after his assassination?
subhead: Benjamin Netanyahu has methodically dismantled the policies of the Labor prime minister who was assassinated by a far-right activist on November 4, 1995, blaming him in particular for signing the Oslo Accords.

title: French lawmakers vote to tax American retirees who freely benefit from social security
subhead: Members of the Assemblée Nationale backed an amendment to the social security that would create a 'minimum contribution' on foreign retirees who receive free healthcare.
